candidates.title: Split crates
candidates.body:
As described in #78, this PR moves crates into the `crates/` directory, the binaries to `svm-rs/src/bin/`, and adds the `cli` and `solc` features to gate their dependencies.
These are:
- `anyhow`
- `clap`
- `indicatif`
- `itertools`
- `dialoguer`
- `console`
- `tokio` ("full" feature)

After doing this, I found that the `rand`, `tokio` and `tempfile` dependencies were only used with `#[cfg(test)]`, so I moved them into `dev-dependencies`.

I also updated the README and the badge links.

#### This reduces `svm-rs` crate size from [~30kB](https://crates.io/crates/svm-rs) to ~23.6KiB, and library dependencies from 183 to 108.

candidates.title: use list from nikitastupin's repo instead of maintaining here
chore: switch `binstall-zip` to `zip`
candidates.body:
Follow up from #65 :

The original `zip` crate cut a new release and the `binstall-zip` fork is now deprecated.

candidates.title: chore: switch `zip` to `binstall-zip`
candidates.body:
The previous version of the zip package has an outdated transitive Rust Crypto dependency that conflicts with newer Rust Crytpo crates, so it's important to update.

The master branch of the `zip` package already contains the new Rust Crytpo dependencies, but it's been waiting for a release for three months now so this commit switches to the updated `binstall-zip` fork by the `cargo-bins` team.

Fore more context, please see: https://github.com/roynalnaruto/svm-rs/pull/62

candidates.title: chore: update solc-builds which includes solidity v0.8.17
fix: solc-builds commit that uses statically linked z3
chore: solc-builds latest commit, bump versions
chore: check for DOCS_RS flag
candidates.body:
`[package.metadata.docs.rs]` settings are only respected for the crate that's being published so current behaviour will cause docs rs build failures in downstream deps

it's recommended to check for DOCS_RS env var: https://docs.rs/about/builds#detecting-docsrs

so if not offline mode also check for DOCS_RS env var

candidates.title: feat: add offline feature
candidates.body:
network access is blocked during docrs builds: https://docs.rs/about/builds

* add offline feature that generates empty constants

candidates.title: feat: extract zip archives on windows
candidates.body:
All solc versions <= 0.7.1 are shipped in .zip archives. These archives also contain some DLLs and I'm unsure if they are needed, so to be sure, we need to extract those as well.

Closes #49

candidates.title: feat: use fs2 for locking and increase request timeout to 60 secs
candidates.body:
* this replaces the old locking code with [`fs2::FileExt`](https://docs.rs/fs2/latest/fs2/trait.FileExt.html)

* also bumps timeout to 60 secs, default is 30 and can be exceeded easily on slow networks

candidates.title: feat(builds): add svm-builds crate
feat: full serde support
candidates.body: implement and simplify full serde for `Releases`

candidates.title: feat: add lock file for solc version while copying contents over
candidates.body:
## Problem

We have observed flaky tests in [Foundry](https://github.com/gakonst/foundry) as reported in [this issue](https://github.com/gakonst/foundry/issues/442).

This is caused by Foundry running multiple tests in parallel, each detecting no solc present, each trying to install and one of them trying to access the `solc-X.Y.Z` binary while the other thread is writing to it (`std::io::Copy` step in the `install` function).

## Solution

We add a `.lock-solc-X.Y.Z` file before starting the copy process for a specific version of solc. If this lock file is present while installing, we wait for a timeout period (10 secs) while checking if we have the green signal to install every interval (500 msecs).

candidates.title: replace structopt with clap3
candidates.body: structopt uses an old version of clap and it causes some trouble with downstream dependencies (e.g. foundry)

candidates.title: fix: trim deps
candidates.body:
We were pulling in OpenSSL to consumers via reqwest, while ideally it should be opt in (e.g. consumer should be able to choose rustls instead). I also turned off default-features for a lot of crates, just in case.

Also checks in the Cargo.lock and closes https://github.com/roynalnaruto/svm-rs/issues/10

candidates.title: fix: old versions checksum & download url
candidates.body:
- fixes download url for linux old solc versions
- fixes conditions for version compare (WRT linux old solc versions)
- adds CI
- adds checksum for linux old versions

candidates.title: feat: checksum matching and delay creating solc-x.y.z file
candidates.body:
- The file `solc-x.y.z` is created only after asynchronously fetching the contents of the fetched solc binary
- After downloading the solc binary we compare the checksum against the fetched checksum
- build script has been removed. the `svm` binary sets up `SVM_HOME` if it does not exist

chosen_pr.title: Split crates
chosen_pr.body:
As described in #78, this PR moves crates into the `crates/` directory, the binaries to `svm-rs/src/bin/`, and adds the `cli` and `solc` features to gate their dependencies.
These are:
- `anyhow`
- `clap`
- `indicatif`
- `itertools`
- `dialoguer`
- `console`
- `tokio` ("full" feature)

After doing this, I found that the `rand`, `tokio` and `tempfile` dependencies were only used with `#[cfg(test)]`, so I moved them into `dev-dependencies`.

I also updated the README and the badge links.

#### This reduces `svm-rs` crate size from [~30kB](https://crates.io/crates/svm-rs) to ~23.6KiB, and library dependencies from 183 to 108.
